def right_angle_triangle(a, b, c):
    '''
    Given the lengths of the three sides of a triangle. Return True if the three
    sides form a right-angled triangle, False otherwise.
    A right-angled triangle is a triangle in which one angle is right angle or 
    90 degree.
    Example:
    right_angle_triangle(3, 4, 5) == True
    right_angle_triangle(1, 2, 3) == False
    '''
    # Determine the angle of one side
    angle_a = math.atan2(b-a, c-a)
    # Determine the angle of the other two sides
    angle_b = math.atan2(c-b, a-b)
    # Determine the angle of the other two sides
    angle_c = math.atan2(b-c, a-c)
    
    # If the three angles are within 90 degrees of each other, the triangle is
    # a right-angled triangle
    return angle_a==angle_b==angle_c and (angle_a+angle_c)!=90

    # If one side is right angle
    if (angle_a==90 or angle_b==90):
        return True
    # If one side is right angle
    if (angle_a==180 or angle_b==180):
        return True
    # If one side is 180 degree
    if (angle_a==270 or angle_b==270):
        return True

    # If the three angles are within 90 degrees of each other, the triangle is a
    # right-angled triangle
    return angle_a==angle_b==angle_c and (angle_a+angle_c)!=90
